snippet: Workers at the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey’s three airports, who used to work directly for the airlines, toil for little pay, and have no unions, vacation days or pensions.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column; workers at Port Authority of New York and New Jersey’s three airports, who used to work directly for airlines, instead now toil for private contractors PrimeFlight and Airways LLC; workers clean terminals and airplane cabins for lower pay and no longer have unions, vacation days or pensions.
lead_paragraph: Workers at the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey’s three airports, who used to work directly for the airlines, toil for little pay, and have no unions, vacation days or pensions.
